Utterance: Hi! It’s nice to see you again. How have you been since our last session?
Hi, Ellie! I’ve been doing pretty well, actually. I took a couple of walks by the beach like we talked about.
That’s fantastic! How did those walks make you feel?
They were really refreshing. I felt so much more relaxed afterward, and I even got some ideas for my screenplay while I was walking.
Classified_Subsection: Physiological Observations: History of Present Illness (HPI)

Utterance: That’s wonderful to hear! It seems like being in nature really helps your creativity. Did you find it easier to focus on your writing afterward?
Yes, definitely! I felt more inspired and motivated to write.
That’s great progress! How has your writing routine been this past week?
I’ve been writing almost every day, which is a big improvement for me.
That’s amazing! What do you think motivated you to stick with it?
I think it was just feeling good about the ideas I had. Plus, I really wanted to keep that momentum going.
Momentum is key! Have you faced any challenges while writing this week?
A few times, I felt a bit of self-doubt creeping in, like maybe my ideas weren’t good enough.
Classified_Subsection: History of Present Illness (HPI): Risk Assessment

Utterance: Self-doubt can be tough. When those thoughts come up, how do you usually respond?
I try to remind myself that it’s part of the process and that not every idea has to be perfect.
That’s a healthy perspective! Would you like to explore some strategies to help manage those self-doubts when they arise?
Yes, I’d love that.
One approach is to create a “success journal.” You can write down positive feedback you’ve received or moments when you felt proud of your work. Would you be willing to try that?
That sounds helpful. I think I’d like to do that.
Great! It can serve as a reminder of your accomplishments during tougher times. Have you had any moments of doubt that stand out recently?
Yes, I had a moment where I thought about submitting one of my screenplays to a contest, but I hesitated because I was worried it wouldn’t be good enough.
Classified_Subsection: History of Present Illness (HPI): Risk Assessment

Utterance: It’s normal to feel that way, especially with something so personal. What do you think would happen if you took the leap and submitted it anyway?
I think I’d feel proud of myself for putting my work out there, regardless of the outcome.
Absolutely! Sometimes taking that risk can lead to growth and new opportunities. Would you be open to setting a goal around submitting your screenplay?
Yes, I’d like to aim to submit it by the end of the month.
That sounds like a solid plan! Remember, it’s about the experience and the growth that comes with it. Is there anything else on your mind today?
Just thinking about some friendships. I feel like I haven’t been as connected to my friends lately.
That’s important to acknowledge. What do you think has contributed to that feeling?
I think I’ve been so focused on my writing that I haven’t made time for socializing.
It’s easy to get wrapped up in our passions. How about setting a goal to reconnect with a friend this week?
That sounds good! I’ll reach out to a couple of them.
Perfect! It’s all about balance. Thank you for sharing your progress and thoughts today. I’m looking forward to hearing about your submissions and reconnections next time!
Thank you, Ellie! I appreciate the support.
You’re welcome! Take care, and see you next week.
Bye!
